Appeal by Special Leave from the judgement other dated the 5th November, 1969 of the Punjab Harayana High Court in Civil Write No. 309 of 1969.
This is an appeal by special leave from the judgment dated 5 November, 1969 of the High Court of Punjab and Haryana.
in Civil Write No. 309 of 1969.

Rule 8 b  of the Punjab Police Service Rules 1959 states that the services of a member recruited by direct appointment may be dispensed with by the Government on his failing to pass the final examination at the end of his period of training, or on his being reported on during or at the end of his period of probation, as unfit for appointment.

concepts.interpretation: Dispenses with services of direct recruit probationer if found unfit during or at end of probation.

concepts.unlisted_description: Requires apprising probationer of grounds and opportunity to show cause if termination proposed for fault or unsatisfactory record.

anchor.surface_text: Second the order of termination was one of punishment and the appellant should,therefore, under Rule 9 of the Punjab Civil Service  Punishment and Appeal  Rules

concepts.unlisted_label: Rule 9 Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules 1952
concepts.unlisted_description: Requires apprising probationer of grounds and opportunity to show cause if termination proposed for fault or unsatisfactory record.

anchor.surface_text: Rule 9 is as follows Where it is proposed to terminate the employment of a probationer, whether during or at the end of the period of probation, for any specific fault or on account of the un- satisfactory record or unfavourable reports implying the unsuitability for the service, the probationer shall be ,apprised of the grounds of such proposal, and given an opportunity to show cause against it, before orders are passed by the authority companypetent to terminate the appointment.

concepts.interpretation: Full text quoted; court holds it inapplicable as termination not punitive.

anchor.surface_text: Reliance is placed on rule 9 where it is said that if the termination of the Services of a probationer be on account of unsatisfactory record he shall be given an opportunity to show cause against it.

concepts.unlisted_label: Rule 9 Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules 1952
concepts.unlisted_description: Requires apprising probationer of grounds and opportunity to show cause if termination proposed for fault or unsatisfactory record.

anchor.surface_text: The respondent relied on rule 11 of the Punjab Police Service Rules where it is stated that in matters relating to discipline, penalties and appeals, members of the Service shall be governed by the Punjab Civil Services  Punishment and Appeal  Rules.

anchor.surface_text: The order terminating the services is unfitness for appointment at the time of companyfirmation, it is number passed on the ground of any turpitude like misconduct or inefficiency. To hold that the words unfit to be appointed are a Stigma would rob the authorities of the power to judge fitness for work or suitability to the post at the time of companyfirmation. Termination of services on account of inadequacy for the job or for any temperamental or other defect number involving moral turpitude is number a stigma which can be called discharge by punishment. Fitness for the job is one of the most important reasons for companyfirmation. The facts and circumstances do number show that there is any stigma attached to the order of termination.

concepts.interpretation: Termination of probationer for unfitness without moral turpitude, misconduct or stigma does not amount to punishment and does not require compliance with Rule 9; mere 'unfit' not stigmatic.

interpretation_anchor.surface_text: ng to discipline, penalties and appeals, members of the Service shall be governed by the Punjab Civil Services  Punishment and Appeal  Rules. Therefor

concepts.unlisted_description: Distinction between simple termination of probationer for unsuitability and punitive termination requiring hearing.

holdings.text: The appellant did not stand confirmed on 19/20 November 1968 because the period of probation had not expired due to extensions and exclusion of leave period.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant could not be confirmed till the period of probation to find out the fitness of the appellant expired. It cannot therefore be held that the appellant stood confirmed on 19/20 November, 1968 before the period of probation expired in January, 1969.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Appointment on probation for two years; extended by one year on 1 July 1967 and further six months from 20 May 1968 after revoking prior termination; leave from 20 May to 2 Aug 1968 excluded from probation period; purpose of extension is to assess fitness till end.

holdings.text: The order of termination under Rule 8(b) of Punjab Police Service Rules 1959 does not violate Rule 9 of Punjab Civil Services (Punishment and Appeal) Rules 1952 as it is not punitive or stigmatic but a simple termination for unfitness without moral turpitude, misconduct or specific fault requiring show cause.

anchor.surface_text: Rule 9 is as follows Where it is proposed to terminate the employment of a probationer, whether during or at the end of the period of probation, for any specific fault or on account of the un- satisfactory record or unfavourable reports implying the unsuitability for the service, the probationer shall be ,apprised of the grounds of such proposal, and given an opportunity to show cause against it, before orders are passed by the authority competent to terminate the appointment. ... The facts and circumstances do not show that there is any stigma attached to the order of termination.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Rule 8(b) permits dispensation for unfitness during/at end of probation; Rule 11 PPSR applies PCSR rules only to discipline/penalties, distinguishing from probation termination; 'unfit for appointment' not stigmatic as no turpitude/misconduct; would undermine authority's power to assess fitness at confirmation if treated as punishment; unsatisfactory record here not implying punitive unsuitability.

justification_sets.label: Rule 8(b) Punjab Police Service Rules 1959 support
Natural Justice - Audi Alteram Partem support
